ygData.subject: Re: [Re: Market in EQ]
ygData.msgSnippet: Agreed. But it s also more than likely to be decaying for people near the end of their banded-wearing career. Hence, the decay after one or two users, instead
ygData.messageBody:
Agreed.

But it's also more than likely to be decaying for people near the end of
their banded-wearing career.

Hence, the decay after one or two users, instead of it being around
indefinately.

----- Original Message -----
From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 12:52 PM
Subject: Re: [Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Market in EQ]


> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> The other problem I have with banded armor decaying, is that it makes it
easier for smiths to make money, and it makes it harder for banded wearing
people to get enough money to buy better armor.
>
> >>> "Mathew E. Gray" <things@...> 7.14.99 2:26:11 PM >>>
> From: "Mathew E. Gray" <things@...>
>
> The point is not to have all armor deteriorate, just Smith/Tailor made
> armor.
>
> If Rubicite armor deteriorated, that'd just be dumb, and increase camping
> for items to an even greater degree.
>
> But if ONE type of armor were to decay, banded should be the one to do it.
> Why? Game balance. Economics. Etc.
>
> Just track the amount of time a piece is in game. Not that difficult.
Make
> it last a good long time. Say 30 days. (24 hours a day, so in actuality,
> if you average 4 hours a day, the banded would last you six months of
> playing EQ.)
>
> Have it degrade a bit, not totally . . .
>
> I think it's a great idea.
>

> From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
> To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>

>
> > From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> >
> > OK, simple question, how many of you people that are for items
> deteriorating and going poof have any magic plate? (none I'd bet)
> >
> > I've spent about 2 months to get the armor that I am now wearing, I'd be
> pissed to an extreem if I were in the middle of a fight and I see a
message
> "Your Charred Black Tunic has fallen appart". That one piece of armor
alone

> >
> > Ok, so you say I should have to get it repaired by a smith. I am DE,
and
> by choice I have lowered my faction to the point where I will never be
able
> to go into Freeport or Rivervale, and due to built in factions, I can not
go

> Which means that I would have to search, not only for a respectable smith
> that I trusted, but also an evil one, or trek my self across the world to
> Qeynos. Simply to get my armor "repaired". Now if that isn't bad
> enough.....
> >
> > Often my group will go deep into a dungeon, deep to the point where
either
> a caster has to group gate us to get us out, or we have to spend 30-45 min
> fighting out way out of the dungeon. And quite often we'll all camp and
> logout in a "safe" spot in the dungeon, so sometimes we will be in a
dungeon
> litterly for days. Now, say I get the message "your rubicite helm is
> begining to weaken, you should take it for repairs soon", that means that
my
> entire group would have to leave the dungeon so that I might quest to get
my
> armor repaired.
> >
> > I find neither to be acceptable. What I do find about this, is that
there
> are some smiths who think they don't make enough money, so they want armor
> to wear out, so it has to either be replaced or repaired (more money for
> smiths). What they fail to concider is the fact that you will not always
be
> wearing banded armor.
> >
> > >>> Peter Wong <lkworthpete@...> 7.14.99 9:19:45 AM >>>
> > From: Peter Wong <lkworthpete@...>
> >
> > XxKommiexX@... wrote:
> > From: XxKommiexX@...
> >
> > It would make people too mad. Having a nice piece of magic armor that
took
> > forever to get disappear because it wore out. I don't like this idea, as
> it
> > would just make EQ more like Diablo and Ultima Online, which I hope they
> > would want to try and stay away from.
> >
> > ------------------------------------------
> >
> > Some other RPG's I've played made it so that common wear items wore
> quicker
> > than others as well as making rare quest items not wear very little or
not
> at
> > all since they are supposed to be considered priceless. I think the
idea
> of
> > making items wear would be a great thing for the trade. A shield and
> sword
> > would wear quicker than say boots or leggings. This gives smiths an
> > oppurtunity to increase their skills with less cost if they want to work
> on
> > repairing and improving items.
